016package edu.cnm.deepdive.rps.controller;
017
018import android.os.Bundle;
019import android.view.Menu;
020import android.view.MenuItem;
021import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
022import androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity;
023import androidx.navigation.NavController;
024import androidx.navigation.fragment.NavHostFragment;
025import androidx.navigation.ui.AppBarConfiguration;
026import androidx.navigation.ui.NavigationUI;
027import dagger.hilt.android.AndroidEntryPoint;
028import edu.cnm.deepdive.rps.R;
029
030/**
031 * Serves as a basic fragment host activity. This activity presents no UI elements of its own, but
032 * hosts a {@link androidx.navigation.fragment.NavHostFragment} navigation controller, to present
033 * (and navigate between) {@link androidx.fragment.app.Fragment} instances, with the navigation
034 * controller wired to an {@link AppBarConfiguration} for automatic updates of the text displayed in
035 * the appbar (aka action bar) when navigating between fragments.
036 */
037@AndroidEntryPoint
038public class MainActivity extends AppCompatActivity {
039
040  @Override
041  protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
042    super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
043    setContentView(R.layout.activity_main);
044    setupActionBar();
045  }
046
047  /**
048   * Treats a press on the "up" button (when displayed&mdash;typically as a left arrow in the action
049   * bar) as equivalent to a "back" navigation. This results in popping the currently displayed
050   * fragment off the stack, and returning to the previously displayed fragment.
051   *
052   * @return {@code true} to indicate that navigation was successful.
053   */
054  @Override
055  public boolean onSupportNavigateUp() {
056    getOnBackPressedDispatcher().onBackPressed();
057    return true;
058  }
059
060  private void setupActionBar() {
061    AppBarConfiguration config = new AppBarConfiguration.Builder(
062        R.id.ecosystem_fragment, R.id.settings_fragment
063    )
064        .build();
065    //noinspection DataFlowIssue
066    NavController controller = ((NavHostFragment)
067        getSupportFragmentManager().findFragmentById(R.id.nav_host_fragment)).getNavController();
068    NavigationUI.setupActionBarWithNavController(this, controller, config);
069  }
070
071}
